title: Fake News: Venezuela Did NOT Declare War On Republic of Paraguay | Lead Stories
subtitle: Did Venezuela just declare war on Paraguay? No, that's not true: some joker uploaded an article making that claim to...
author: leadstories.com
vclaim:
Did Venezuela just declare war on Paraguay? No, that's not true: some joker uploaded an article making that claim to a prank website that allows anyone to create a realistic-looking news article, but it is not real.

The story originated from an article published on 12minutos.com on January 12, 2019 titled "VENEZUELA DECLARA LA GUERRA A LA REPUBLICA DE PARAGUAY" (archived here) which opened:

Today, January 10, 2019, the re-elected president of the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela, the Colombian Nicolás Maduro, has expressed his disagreement and discomfort over the decision taken by the president of the Paraguayans Mario Abdo Benitez to cancel diplomatic relations with the aforementioned Bolivarian country. According to President Maduro, "This is an insult to all Venezuelans, even more than thanks to us and the ideological development of our late president in the Chavez skies. The union of the Mercosur countries has been created," the president concluded his speech. Maduro in response to the official communication of the Paraguayan state of closure of his embassy, said the Venezuelan president "we already communicate to the United States of America our decision.

Users on social media only saw this title, description and thumbnail and the story racked up thousands of engagements on Facebook:

The site that published the story is a prank website where users can submit their own headline, description and photo to create realistic looking prank news articles.

Users don't even need to upload their own image, there is a built-in search function that will pull an appropriate image from Google image search.

The site is part of a larger network of prank sites all using the same basic layout but sometimes in different languages. It appears to be run by a Belgian company named Mediavibes or Media Vibes which is managed by a man named Nicolas Gouriou according to registration records.

Each site in the network comes with a disclaimer (sometimes translated into a different language) that reads:

So don't fall for this prank now that we've warned you about it!

We wrote about 12minutos.com before, here are our most recent articles that mention the site:
• Fake News: Belgium Did NOT Issue International Arrest Warrant For Mariano Rajoy
• Fake News: Hurricane Irma NOT Heading For Argentina, Brasil Or Paraguay
• Fake News: Andorra Did NOT Close Border With Catalonia
• Fake News: Pink Floyd NOT To Perform at Valle de la Luna
